Honey-Glazed Roasted Root Vegetables
Korean Cabbage Pancakes
  1. Home
  2. Recipes
3.4 240

Honey-Glazed Roasted Root Vegetables

  • Active: 25 MIN
  • Total Time: 1 HR 30 MIN
  • Servings: 12

The secret to this sweet, slightly tangy dish: the touch of sherry vinegar in the glaze.

 More Thanksgiving Side Dishes

KEY: Fall, Winter, Roasting, Christmas, Dinner Party, Thanksgiving, American, Side Dishes, Healthy, Make Ahead, Vegetarian

Related Video

More Videos
How to Cook Vegetables Perfectly Every Time

Ingredients

  • 1 1/4 pounds parsnips, peeled and sliced 1/2 inch thick
  • 1 1/4 pounds carrots, peeled and sliced 1/2 inch thick
  • One 1 1/4 pound celery rootpeeled, quartered and sliced 1/2 inch thick
  • 1 1/4 pounds golden beets, peeled and sliced 1/2 inch thick
  • 1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil
  • 1/2 cup honey
  • 6 thyme sprigs
  • Salt and freshly ground pepper
  • 2 tablespoons sherry vinegar

How to make this recipe

  1. Preheat the oven to 425°. In a large bowl, toss the root vegetables with the oil, honey and thyme and season with salt and pepper. Divide between 2 large, sturdy rimmed baking sheets. Cover with foil and roast for 40 minutes, shifting the pans once, until the vegetables are tender. Remove the foil and roast for 10 minutes longer, until glazed. Return them to the bowl and stir in the vinegar then season with salt and pepper. Serve right away.

Make Ahead

The vegetables can be cooked early in the day and kept at room temperature before rewarming.

Contributed By Grace Parisi Photo © John Kernick Published November 2007
